item.description: What I completed this week: Submitted my synphot tutorials as a pull request to astropy/astropy-tutorials. Just waiting for someone (outside of my GSoC mentors) to review! item.title: Start to work on PFSS
item.dc:creator: Tianxiao MA
item.description: In this week, I started to move to Potential Field Source Surface (PFSS) models. I am going to make an introduction to these models in this post.PFSS models are aiming to solve the magnetic field satisfying∇ × B = 0, ∇ · B = 0in a spherical region with appropriate boundary conditions. Therefore, thi ...READ MORE...

item.title: Week 11: A wrapper says its first word
item.dc:creator: astrojansen
item.description: What I completed this week: Continued working on the synphot wrapper class, which we’ve renamed “Exposure” (since “Observe” is a little too close to the other synphot class “Observation”). So far this class works pretty much like how I imagined it last week, where the most simple (read: default) syn ...READ MORE...

item.title: In-depth comparison between the optimization algorithms implemented
item.dc:creator: Juan Redondo
item.description: On this post I am going to show a comparison between the different optimization algorithms implemented till now in CTLearn, all of them applied to the same telescope and with the same configuration. This is useful to find the similarities and differences between optimization methods, as well as chec ...READ MORE...

item.title: Visualization of 3D vector fields
item.dc:creator: Tianxiao MA
item.description: In the past few weeks, I spent a lot of time learning how to visualize a 3D vector field interactively.
